channel.title: Mod t or anyone please help me
channel.description:
Ok im trying to make my own server and i went to fire wall and added a new port (43594) now it says: Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:
Name: 1 IP address: 2 TCP Ports to open: 43594 UDP Ports to open: Inbound Filter: Allow All Schedule: Always
can anyone tell me in english what this means?

item.title: Mod t or anyone please help me
item.dc:creator: @aaronr69 aaronr69
item.description:
@aaronr69 wrote:

ok go to start>run>cmd>ipconfig then a black screen should b up with a buck of numbers look for one that says ip or default gateway and type that into your web browser after that a screen should come up and ask for a user name and pass witch is usally username:admin and and passowrk or admin for password and no user name the nwhen you get to the next screen go to the advanced tab at the top then to the side click “gaming” button then make the new rule and paste in

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always

hope it helps

Read full topic
item.source: Mod t or anyone please help me

item.title: Mod t or anyone please help me

@revolgup wrote:

Ok im trying to make my own server and i went to fire wall and added a new port (43594) now it says:
Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Then on the sidebar to the left click the “gaming” button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

IP address: 2

UDP Ports to open:
